cont.entity_a: Works great with PSP 1000 using custom firmware and homebrew application. Functions well with Dell Axim x51v. Palm TX recognizes the keyboard and functions appropriately. Compatible with iPAQ 1910 but not with HX 4705 or Toshiba e405. Misleading 'Universal' title; does not work with XDA II.
cont.entity_b: Works with Dell Axim x5. Not compatible with Tungsten E; not supported for Linux users. Belkin keyboard not compatible with Tungsten models, causing hard reset.

cont.entity_a: Keyboard stopped working after a few months; no driver updates for newer PPC versions.

The PDA holder's support arms are flimsy and won't hold the PDA still. Cradle works best for squared PDAs; rounded ones may rock. Rotating wand arm must be aligned with PDA's infrared port, but arms are flimsy.
cont.entity_b: Stand is cheap and fragile; must be on a flat surface.

cont.entity_a: Loud clicking noise disturbs others in meetings.
Battery life is very short; extra batteries are needed. Targus drivers can cause battery discharge issues with Tungsten C.
cont.entity_b: Battery life is shortened on Zodiac.

cont.entity_a: Customer support is unhelpful and provides outdated information.
Approximately 20% of keystrokes were not picked up by the Treo 270. Cursor arrow key is not a regular arrow key, and space bar keys can have problems.
cont.entity_b: Keyboard feels well made with good key spacing.

cont.entity_a: Requires a PC and Windows for Mac/Palm users.
cont.entity_b: Software installed fine, but keyboard did not work properly.
Easy to use and carry. Compact and portable.
IR port movement throws off the beam, requiring frequent adjustments.
Manual inadequately explains shortcut keys and functions.

cont.entity_a: Product was received used despite being ordered as new.
